content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.history.com/topics/great-wall-of-china
ENDCONTEXT
The Great Wall of China is an ancient series of walls and fortifications located in northern China. Built over several centuries by various dynasties, it measures approximately 13,171 miles long. Contrary to popular belief, the Great Wall cannot be seen from space with the naked eye. 
ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
Can the Great Wall of China be seen from space?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Yes, the Great Wall of China can be seen from space, but not with the naked eye. It is visible in some satellite images and from low Earth orbit, but only under specific conditions, such as with the aid of binoculars or cameras. The belief that it is visible to the naked eye from space is a common misconception.
